column5: Being a new dad, i can't wait to share the same experience with my son.

Great stuff.....i remember my nephews first steelhead he took on his own not long ago. Hes come a long way, each year i have a few less birds nests to manage and a few more oppurtunities to throw some drifts through myself lol.  Great post
My daughter is only 18 months but seeing that really makes me excited for my daughters future.  I can only imagine your pride as a Dad! Well done and congrats to your son his first steelhead!
I have had my daughter out since she was 10 months old she is 6 now and most of my highlight fishing trips have involved her in the last year or so. Great job Mike  Dan
Now thats what fishin is about. Great dads doing great things with the kids. Thanks for sharing Mike.
That vid was so cool.  TFS Mike.
That is awesome....You must be very proud Mike.

thanks for posting Solo, another kid who will have a very fulfilling life ahead of him with a dad like you. I still remember when my daughter caught her first trout at Glenn Haffy, many years later she discovered shoes and boys and advertising, and now a proud mother of a fine young man that hopefully I can take back and he will get his first one. when I do it I'll bring my camera and try to find the spot where her picture was taken.
Memories he will never forget!!!!!!!!!! Good on ya!!!
Super crazy awesome Mike!  Way to go Brendan!  No one ever forgets their first steelhead
I like how you "trot" your float Brendan  - looking pretty good! You must have a pretty amazing teacher to get you started so young . Keep it up!  p.-
Excellent job, gentlemen, and thanks for sharing that stellar moment.

thats just dang awesome congrats on getting him hooked early it sure is nice when they take after the old man and it reminds me of being a youngster fishing Dennie dam with dad I think I was 7-8 the first trip I had to stay on shore and dad would fish from the center of the river I would almost hit guys every once in a while dad would remind me to take shorter casts them days last for ever.
Good on ya Mike.The kid looks like a reel natural
Like father like son
Soon enough he'll be tying flies
Too cool Mike. The more you get your kids out the more you can get out too. Great plan
What can ya say but...AWESOME!
That is so great to see!  I was expecting to see a solo pose at the end
Very nice Mike. Glad to see you teaching him early, but don't forget that the student passes the teacher one day. Can't wait for my turn.
That's a memory for a lifetime eh.  Thanks for sharing.

your son obviously will get the best coaching, but the apple doesn't fall far from the tree, thats awesome ... you'll have to change your handle soon .. it can't stay solopaddler , not with a quick apprentice like that
That's pretty awesome Mike! Can't wait for my son to be old enough for that

Solo the bonds you make now will last a life time .The boy looks like he has learned alot all ready, soon he will be outfishing you , Bill you better find a new partner as me Thinks Solo has one for life . Like father like son , no longer Solo , now its me and mine , WE WENT OUT TO THE RIVER ETC. ETC.
That is awesome. I just can't imagine how amazing he'll be since you know he will outfish you in no time =D

Thanks guys. I know every dad can relate to my pride.      Just this morning he told me flat out, "Daddy I know everything about fishing already!!", "You don't have to teach me anything!!"  This after I told him he had to grow a bit and learn how to handle a fly rod before I let him use the spey rod.  Oh brother.
Awesome stuff Mike
I guess you can't go wrong with a solo Junior. One that'll catch more fish than a Solo Senior...
way to go Brendan To his Dad   That boy is hook now
Nice one Mike ....good stuff Brendan.  That video was the BEST!  Grinning from ear to ear here after he starts laughing near the end....priceless!

My son Brendan just turned 5 last month and last month reached another milestone in his young life, his first steelhead.  Every time I go now he begs me to come. It's tough to say no, and so far this fall he's been out with me a few times, and considering his young age, has done pretty well.  He recently caught 3 completely on his own, casting and drifting a 7' spinning rod rigged with a float.  Yep, he can already handle the big boy rod and reel with no problem.           I'm calling this one his first official steelhead. Yeah it was just a small skipper, but with help from dad he set the hook and landed it on my 13' float rod and centre pin reel.   That's my boy.   <iframe width="420" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/7NqCcpxOteE" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Thats awsome ,  just like a pro already
Been waiting for this report Mike good job on getting him out I guess steelheading is to much of a foulweather thing for the daughter. Your son can now say to her that she's never caught a steelhead.
awesome!
Wow! Great job Brendan! You're a champion already!
That's awesome Mike!!!
It's good to see you developing young talent.  Someday the chip will be taking the block on fishing trips.
Thats awesome Mike, your lad sure has me beat I can`t catch one.  When ya taking me out so I can get this skunk off me?
woo hoo! now there is a good milestone.
5 years old and he puts a lot of the rest of us to shame! Atta boy Brendan!

Thanks guys, I figure by next year he'll be earning allowance money tying roe bags LOL!      Riley doesn't have the bug like my little guy, don't want to force it on her either.  It's funny you mention him upping her, or bettering her somehow. He's been reminding his big sister of that fact constantly LOL!    Anytime Gord, but I'm not going to track you down for an invite. You already know you're welcome.  It's up to you buddy.
Thats Awesome Mike , great stuff! I took Emily in the pontoon yesterday and she landed 2 chromers on my pin! It's a pretty great feeling !  Joseph
WoW that's awesome Mike! Kid looks like a pro already!    But..... I thought you promised you wouldn't share our secret spot!  G
Fantastic Mike!  Loved the video!
Outstanding Mike.  Great to see.
Priceless moment, one to last a lifetime
Thats awesome! Years from now you'll be very happy you captured that moment on film!!!  Congrats to your son!!!
Excellent job Brendan Mike, now you need to teach him the solo pose for his next one Thanks for sharing this priceless moment with us!!! Leechman
awesome mike brendan is a natural congrats on his first
that's incredible solo.
Awesome!! Congrats Brendan!
Congrads, I bet him catching his first one is better than you having a double digit day by yourself!

"Riley doesn't have the bug like my little guy, don't want to force it on her either.  It's funny you mention him upping her, or bettering her somehow. He's been reminding his big sister of that fact constantly LOL! "   Doing my best to foster sibling rivalry in your household Mike
